SENT.plain: Cardiac valve involvement in antiphospholipid syndrome (APS) has been consistently shown
However, isolated tricuspid valve disease within this syndrome has only been recently reported
We report a patient with primary antiphospholipid syndrome who had isolated tricuspid organic valve disease, pulmonary hypertension and pulmonary thromboembolism
We suggest that the APS should be listed as one of the aetiologies of organic isolated tricuspid valve disease in the adult population
